choices.choice: Ratio between ambient pressure and exhaust pressure.
Ratio between ambient pressure and fan pressure.
Ratio between intake pressure and compressor delivery pressure.
Ratio between exhaust pressure and intake pressure.

question: In a high by pass engine whose fan max rpm is 20000rpm, when turning at 5000rpm will develop approx.

choices.choice: 25% take off thrust.
50% take off thrust
5% take off thrust
15% take off thrust.

subject: Technical

question: With an increase in altitude which of the following statements are correct for a jet aircraft with constant engine speed for a fixed throttle setting? 1. Temperature and pressure reduce with a resulting drop in thrust. 2. Fuel consumption will increase. 3. Fuel consumption will decrease. 4. Specific fuel consumption will increase. 5. Specific fuel consumption will decrease. 6. Specific fuel consumption stays relatively the same 7. Temperature and pressure will reduce, resulting in an increase in thrust.
subject: Technical

question: The maximum thrust that a jet engine can develop will be:

choices.choice: Take off thrust.
Go around thrust.
Max climb thrust.
Max Static Thrust.

subject: Technical

question: As temperature ___________air density ____________ and the mass of air for given engine speed __________ therefore thrust ___________. To maintain the compressor speed however _______ fuel must be added or the compressor will _________.

choices.choice: decreases decreases increases increases less slow down
increases decreases decreases increases more slow down
decreases increases increases increases more slow down
increases decreases increases decreases less speed up

subject: Technical

question: From a standing start with an increase in forward speed jet thrust will:

choices.choice: Increase.
Stay the same.
Decrease.
Decrease then recover but will never achieve its initial setting.

subject: Technical

question: On a turboprop aircraft with a 14 stage axial flow compressor while climbing it will experience:

choices.choice: Increase shaft horse-power increase jet thrust increase fuel consumption
Decrease shaft horse-power decrease jet thrust decrease fuel consumption
Decrease shaft horse-power increase jet thrust decrease fuel consumption
Decrease shaft horse-power decrease jet thrust increase fuel consumption

subject: Technical

question: On a turboprop aircraft with a 14 stage axial flow compressor while increasing forward speed, it will experience:

choices.choice: Increase shaft horse-power increase jet thrust
Decrease shaft horse-power decrease jet thrust
Decrease shaft horse-power increase jet thrust
Increase shaft horse-power decrease jet thrust

subject: Technical

question: On a part throttled engine, take off thrust would be achieved:

choices.choice: Later than normal due to pressure in the compressor being low.
Later than normal due to the EPR being low.
Earlier than normal.
Later than normal due to the EPR being high.

subject: Technical

Ram pressure is unaffected by airspeed.

Thrust is maximum and ram pressure at minimum at the start of the take off run.
